chunk:
About Teach For Nepal
Teach for Nepal is a movement of outstanding university graduates and young professionals 
who are committed to end education inequity in Nepal starting with two years of fellowship 
teaching in public schools.
Teach For Nepal fellowship is a two year long, full-time paid employment opportunity. During 
the two years, Fellows teach in public schools and bring about academic achievement and 
transformative impact in their students. At the same time, they harness their leadership skills 
through the teaching experience and intensive development training and support.
Please click here to read our latest Annual Report.
Our Vision
One day, all children in Nepal will attain an excellent education and become leaders of our 
Democracy, our Economy, and our Nation towards Justice, Peace and Sustainability.
Public schools, we believe, are where future leaders, entrepreneurs, academics, innovators,

Democracy, our Economy, and our Nation towards Justice, Peace and Sustainability.
Public schools, we believe, are where future leaders, entrepreneurs, academics, innovators, 
and thinkers should be nurtured. 75% of our students attend public schools; however, the 
majority of them are not getting the kind of education that puts them on a path of prosperity or 
prepares them as leaders.
Teach For Nepal Fellowship is not just about Fellows creating immediate impact in the 
classroom and improving the student learning outcomes but also about exercising their agency
in ways where they can also cultivate students as leaders who are informed and have the 
agency to participate and act on several opportunities and challenges that we face as a human
society.
Thus, in 2015, Teach For Nepal engaged in a series of community exercises that raised the 
question on the purpose of education and our vision for our children. We asked different

society.
Thus, in 2015, Teach For Nepal engaged in a series of community exercises that raised the 
question on the purpose of education and our vision for our children. We asked different 
community members – after completing education, what kind of a person do we want our 
children to ultimately become? What is the kind of knowledge, skills and attitudes that they will
have? What kind of role will they be playing in the family, community, and nation at large? 
What values will they be guided by?
The outcome of the yearlong exercise is what we call Student Vision which also directs us to 
teach and engage with our students in ways that expand the scope of our work from mere 
academics to cultivating students as leaders in their community and as global citizens. Over 
several years of continued discussion in communities, this has now evolved to include: 
Education and Lifelong learning; digital literacy, technology; entrepreneurship, Financial

several years of continued discussion in communities, this has now evolved to include: 
Education and Lifelong learning; digital literacy, technology; entrepreneurship, Financial 
Literacy and Employability Skills; Health happiness and wellbeing, Climate Action; Social 
Generated with https://kome.ai

Justice, Democracy and Human rights; and Leadership skills to drive positive impact in 
communities.
OUR STUDENT VISION
FOR THE NEXT DECADE
Education & Learning
Digital Literacy & Technology
Entrepreneurship, Financial Literacy & Employability Skills
Health, happiness & well being
Climate Justice: Global to Local Action
Social Justice, Democracy & Human Rights
Leadership skills to drive postive impact in their community & nation at large: Sense of 
Purpose and Agency, Grit, Communication, Collaboration, and design thinking, and life long 
learning.
CORE VALUES
INTEGRITY
We consider integrity a virtue. We commit to uphold highest standards of ethical expectations 
in our action.
SENSE OF URGENCY
We believe the issue of quality of education is an urgent one. We take each and every action 
with full realization that our work now means that children in under-privileged context could 
have significantly better life opportunities than what is possible today.
SENSE OF POSSIBILITY

with full realization that our work now means that children in under-privileged context could 
have significantly better life opportunities than what is possible today.
SENSE OF POSSIBILITY
We believe in the possibility of transformational change in Nepal. We have faith that each child
can excel, grow and become what s/he wants. Each individual has a capacity to transform 
oneself and others.
EXCELLENCE
We strive to excel in each of our action. Excellent actions will bring excellent results.
CONTINUOUS LEARNING
We commit to learn from each other, our partners, and our stakeholders. Through constant 
learning, we strive to create excellence in outcomes.
Generated with https://kome.ai

LEADERSHIP
We stand up when others give up. We dream and take actions to achieve our dreams. We 
lead and inspire others to follow. We make impossible happen.
MUTUAL RESPECT AND RESPONSIBILITY
Our thoughts and actions will be guided by deep respect and responsibility to each other. We 
are aware by the challenges that is in us and around us. We serve to liberate others and 
ourselves from the challenges that exist in us and among us.

Donate
https://www.teachfornepal.org/tfn/donate/usd/tfn/self/
With your NPR 10,000 contribution to the '10,000 Dreams' campaign, you can power a 
Fellow’s mission
In Nepal, many public schools lack engaging learning environments. Students in these 
communities often fall behind, not because of their potential, but because of the limitations of 
the system. Too many young people are left without the skills or confidence to break free from 
the cycle of poverty. Empowering Students Through Fellows Teach For Nepal’s Fellows are 
passionate leaders who teach, mentor, and empower students in these underserved 
communities. With a focus on academic excellence and socio-emotional growth, our Fellows 
go beyond classrooms to become agents of change in the lives of their students. On average, 
each of our Fellows teaches approximately 100 students every year, and the cost of 
supporting one Fellow is NPR 10,00,000. That means just NPR 10,000 is enough to support a

each of our Fellows teaches approximately 100 students every year, and the cost of 
supporting one Fellow is NPR 10,00,000. That means just NPR 10,000 is enough to support a 
student’s education for an entire year through a Teach For Nepal Fellow. Funds raised will 
provide essential resources, Fellow stipends, and training to ensure students receive a 
holistic, high-quality education. Why Your Support Matters Your contribution to this campaign is
not just a donation. It’s an investment in the future of Nepal. By supporting Teach For Nepal, 
you are: Providing students with opportunities to learn and lead. Enabling Fellows to become 
leaders who inspire systemic change. Helping to create a more equitable education system 
across Nepal.
Generated with https://kome.ai

WHY WE’RE NEEDED
Teach For Nepal nurtures every student’s potential and cultivates leaders to enhance 
education. We’re here to help more children succeed and shape Nepal’s future—because 
every young dream matters.
WHY THE PROBLEM?
These numbers are neither inevitable nor intractable. There are several reasons why our 
public education is failing. Teach for Nepal focuses on two primary problems:
1. Lack of sufficient resources
Most public schools are under-resourced and struggle to both get and retain teachers. In 
schools where the government has not allocated enough teachers, or in remote areas where 
teachers do not want to live, primary school teachers have to teach secondary level students. 
As a result, teachers are overburdened and the education of students appearing for the SLC is
being compromised by teachers who are not qualified to adequately prepare them to excel in 
the board examination.
2. Socio-cultural orientation against a teaching career

being compromised by teachers who are not qualified to adequately prepare them to excel in 
the board examination.
2. Socio-cultural orientation against a teaching career
Our social and cultural orientation is such that the best and the brightest Nepali minds are 
discouraged from pursuing teaching as a career. Those who do extremely well in the SLC are 
expected to choose a career in science, technology, or business. The teaching profession, 
especially in the primary and secondary levels at public schools, is often viewed as a last 
choice, if one at all. This contributes to the significant existing gaps in knowledge and capacity 
available at public schools.
MODEL OF CHANGE
Teach For Nepal Model
To address the immediate need for education equity in Nepal, and to bring long term systemic 
change, Teach for Nepal believes that we need a sustained social movement of individuals 
who are committed to ensuring that all children in Nepal receive quality education. To this end,

change, Teach for Nepal believes that we need a sustained social movement of individuals 
who are committed to ensuring that all children in Nepal receive quality education. To this end, 
Teach for Nepal will recruit outstanding university graduates and young professionals from all 
fields. Selected applicants, our "Fellows", will receive training and support in transformational 
teaching to make an immediate impact in the classroom. As alumni, they will lead various 
initiatives to bring about systemic change in the long term.
Generated with https://kome.ai

Immediate impact in the classroom
Teach for Nepal will recruit Fellows in Nepal and among Nepalis abroad to teach in high-need 
public schools for two years. Teach for Nepal will primarily recruit individuals with the 
knowledge and skills to teach Math, English, and Science. They will receive intensive training 
in transformational teaching. Teach for Nepal will also provide resources and support to enable
them to have an immediate impact in their classrooms. Through dedication, hard work, and 
passion Fellows will help their students make measurable academic achievement during their 
tenure.
Transformation through experience
During their two years of teaching, Fellows will gain deeper insights into the problems of 
educational inequality in Nepal. They will develop an understanding of the challenges that 
students, schools, and communities face in high-need areas. Their experience and success in 
the classroom will help them develop a conviction that pervasive inequalities can be

students, schools, and communities face in high-need areas. Their experience and success in 
the classroom will help them develop a conviction that pervasive inequalities can be 
eradicated. Their experiences in classrooms will help the Fellows develop confidence and 
commitment, which will guide them towards innovating solutions and to becoming further 
committed to engage in the long term.
Long term systematic change
Teach For Nepal builds an alumni network that works inside and outside the education system 
to bring fundamental transformation. Moved by the experience of the classrooms and with the 
conviction of the insights they have gained as teachers, Teach For Nepal Alumni now become 
advocates and organizers, policy makers and entrepreneurs, political and social leaders, 
educationist and administrators – leaders in different sectors – with one vision: to end inequity 
in education and bring quality education to all children in Nepal.
The solution is Leadership.

educationist and administrators – leaders in different sectors – with one vision: to end inequity 
in education and bring quality education to all children in Nepal.
The solution is Leadership.
It’s easy to assume that there’s a single cause behind the challenges faced by Nepal’s public 
education system. Commonly, teachers’ capacity and principals’ leadership are scrutinized, 
with discussions often pointing to the individuals in these roles as the main source of the 
problem. However, the truth is far more complex. The issues in our education system are 
deeply systemic, influenced by a wide range of factors and players within the education 
ecosystem. These include government bodies, local education authorities, policymakers, 
teachers’ unions, civil society organizations, international agencies, and even global agendas 
shaping education reforms. Each of these elements plays a role in either supporting or 
Generated with https://kome.ai

hindering the progress of public education. Given the complexity of the problem, there is no 
single, one-size-fits-all solution for improving Nepal’s public education system. The key lies in 
injecting the entire education ecosystem with youth leaders who are deeply rooted in the local 
context. These young leaders possess the knowledge, skills, and innovative thinking needed 
to understand the system’s challenges and drive meaningful change. By empowering them to 
take an active role, we can rejuvenate the system, creating a more dynamic, responsive, and 
sustainable education environment. This approach ensures that reforms are relevant, 
effective, and led by those who truly understand the needs of students and communities.
We cannot ensure equitable education for all children in Nepal without a systemic reform 
where all entities within the ecosystem undergo revision, revival and rejuvenation. For this we

We cannot ensure equitable education for all children in Nepal without a systemic reform 
where all entities within the ecosystem undergo revision, revival and rejuvenation. For this we 
need to invest in a new generation of Nepali youth leaders, who are rooted in the reality of our 
communities, deeply embody the values of service, transformational change and collaboration,
leading systemic reform across these sectors.
Generated with https://kome.ai

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) About 
Fellowship
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
WHY SHOULD I JOIN TEACH FOR NEPAL?
 
Teach For Nepal offers a unique opportunity for you to grow as a leader while having a significant 
and immediate impact on education inequity in Nepal. Teach For Nepal Fellowship is a highly 
competitive, challenging, and rewarding leadership development program. It is an opportunity to 
make a real difference in one of the most important social issues of our time.- education inequity 
in Nepal, while equipping you with valuable skills that will enable you to launch a career in any 
field. Over the two years, you will hone your skills in a variety of areas including communication, 
planning, project management and implementation, and teamwork. As a classroom instructor, 
you are uniquely poised to set your students on new paths and to lead them to success both in 
and out of school. And as a member of the movement, you join a network of leaders and change

you are uniquely poised to set your students on new paths and to lead them to success both in 
and out of school. And as a member of the movement, you join a network of leaders and change 
agents both locally and internationally. You will leave Teach For Nepal prepared and confident to 
meet whatever comes next.
 
WHO IS A TEACH FOR NEPAL 'FELLOW'?
 
Fellow is the term we have chosen to call the college graduates who will be trained and working 
as teachers. They are members of the Corps, or group of leaders working to address educational 
injustice.
 
IS TEACH FOR NEPAL FELLOWSHIP A VOLUNTARY 
POSITION?
 
Teach For Nepal Fellowship is not a voluntary leadership program, rather this is an opportunity 
with a paid stipend. Fellows receive a monthly stipend. In most communities, they receive 
accommodation support as well.
 
HOW MUCH WILL I BE PAID DURING THE FELLOWSHIP?
 
Teach For Nepal Fellows will be paid on a monthly stipend basis during the entire two years of

accommodation support as well.
 
HOW MUCH WILL I BE PAID DURING THE FELLOWSHIP?
 
Teach For Nepal Fellows will be paid on a monthly stipend basis during the entire two years of 
Fellowship. Starting 2023, Teach For Nepal Fellows have been paid a stipend of Rs. 22,500 per 
month during the two years of Fellowship.
 
HOW LONG AM I EXPECTED TO COMMIT TO TEACH FOR

NEPAL?
 
Teach For Nepal Fellowship contract is for two years of full-time work. After the Fellowship is 
over, we hope you will remain engaged as a part of the Teach For Nepal Alumni movement.
 
WHY DO YOU REQUIRE TWO YEARS?
 
Teach For Nepal believes that two years is necessary for Fellows to have a meaningful impact on 
the lives of children in high need schools. Our belief is based on the experience of other 
programs in the Teach For All network, which has demonstrated that two years is minimum 
amount of time you need to both learn and grow as a teacher and a member of the community 
you’ve joined — and then have a significant impact on your students. The first year in any job is 
largely spent adjusting and learning the demands of your new position, and building relationships 
with other teachers and community members. The second year is when you get to build on and 
put into practice the wealth of learning you will have acquired in the first year. The Fellowship is

with other teachers and community members. The second year is when you get to build on and 
put into practice the wealth of learning you will have acquired in the first year. The Fellowship is 
the first step in a long term process of change — the two years, then, are just the beginning.
 
WHERE WILL I WORK?
 
You will work in a government and community schools in Teach For Nepal placement region. 
Currently Teach For Nepal works in 4 districts: Sindhupalchowk, Dhanusha, Parsa, and Tanahu 
districts.
 
WHO WILL I BE TEACHING?
 
You will be teaching students in community schools starting with grade 5 and above.
 
WHAT WILL I BE TEACHING?
 
You will teach either math, science, Computer, or English. One Fellow will teach one subject to 
multiple grades.
 
WHEN WILL I JOIN?
 
Teach For Nepal learning institute will start from the first week of February. TFN places its new 
cohort of Fellows in the classroom every year in the mid of April, the beginning of the next 
academic year.

cohort of Fellows in the classroom every year in the mid of April, the beginning of the next 
academic year.
 
I HAVE NEVER TAUGHT BEFORE. HOW WILL I KNOW 
HOW TO TEACH?
 
We are looking for people who may never before have considered teaching as part of their career 
path. To ensure success in the classroom, Teach For Nepal is developing an intensive six-week 
residential training that will cover lesson planning, classroom management, community relations, 
and much more. In addition to six weeks of preservice training, our Fellows will receive ongoing 
support and regular training during the two years of Fellowship.
 
WHEN WILL I START TEACHING?

We will be placing our fourteenth cohort of Teach For Nepal Fellows in the classroom in Baisakh 
2083 BS — at the beginning of the next school year.
 
WHERE WILL I LIVE WHILE I TEACH?
 
You will be living in a community where you are placed by Teach For Nepal. Ideally, you are 
placed at homes within the community where you are teaching. Living in the community, you can 
develop a closer relationship with the people in the community.
 
WHO CAN APPL Y FOR TEACH FOR NEPAL?
 
If you are a Nepali citizen, or NRN and have completed a Bachelor’s degree, you are eligible to 
apply for the Fellowship. We are looking especially for people who have demonstrated leadership 
potential, interest in social change, and growth mindset with content mastery in science, math, 
computer and English.

How Can I Help?
Here's how you can help us!
Donate
You can sponsor a Fellow of your choice: Choose Fellow
You can donate to a School of your choice: Choose School
You can sponsor a Project of your choice: Choose Project
You can help Teach For Nepal meet its expenses, just click on Donate.
Get Involved
You have a big heart, excellent ideas and want to help in ways other than making a monetary 
donation (e.g. providing stationaries for a school, volunteering at a school, donating books 
etc). Well, not a problem at all! Please tell us a bit more about yourself by filling out this form. 
We’ll get in touch with you as soon as we can.
Create Campaign
Once you sign up with us, you can login to your profile and create fundraising Campaigns to 
raise funds for Fellow, School or Project.
Become
a Fellow
Are you looking to apply to become a Fellow? You can do so if you are a Nepali citizen or of 
Nepali origin with a minimum Bachelor’s degree. Our recruitment season usually runs from

Become
a Fellow
Are you looking to apply to become a Fellow? You can do so if you are a Nepali citizen or of 
Nepali origin with a minimum Bachelor’s degree. Our recruitment season usually runs from 
June to November. When we are hiring fellows, an Apply link will appear at the top right corner
of the page. Just click on the link to get started. Come join us and become a Fellow. We 
guarantee that it will change your life forever.
Volunteer
At Teach For Nepal we are always looking for volunteers to help us in the office or to support 
our outreach efforts. Please call or send an email to tell us what makes you unique and how 
you hope to contribute.
Don't find what you are looking for? Please feel free to contact us by phone or email to explain
exactly how is it that you want to help. We'd love to hear from you!

TEACH FOR NEPAL FELLOWSHIP
Teach For Nepal Fellowship is an opportunity for brightest and most promising Nepali youths, 
who have graduated from best universities and workplace from Nepal and abroad, to serve as 
full-time teachers. Annually hundreds of outstanding graduates apply for the Fellowship of 
which, only 7-10% of applicants are eligible to become a Fellow and enroll onto the program 
from a range of diverse academic backgrounds.
Through two years of teaching and working with key education stakeholders, Teach For Nepal 
Fellows are exposed to the grassroots realities of Nepal’s education system and cultivate the 
knowledge, skills, and mindsets needed to attain positions of leadership in and beyond 
education, working collectively to build a vibrant movement for educational equity across 
Nepal.
Problem as we see it
Every child deserves the opportunity to shape their own future and livea fulfilling life. However,

Nepal.
Problem as we see it
Every child deserves the opportunity to shape their own future and livea fulfilling life. However,
a child's background often influences their life outcomes. Children from less privileged 
communities do not receive the same educational opportunities as their peers. Social and 
economic gaps have further widened this educational divide, making it even more challenging 
for these children to access quality education.
Theory of Change
Short-Term Impact: The Fellowship
Fellows teach in rural schools for two years, significantly improving students' academic 
outcomes and gaining firsthand experience of educational challenges.
Long-Term Impact: Alumni Leadership
Alumni leverage their Fellowship experience to become leaders in various sectors, driving 
lasting improvements in Nepal's education system.
461
Fellows have successfully completed the two-year Fellowship and are now Teach For Nepal 
Alumni.
*55% work across the education sector

Who are our Fellows?
Every year 3500-4000 individuals apply for the Fellowship, and 461 have already completed 
their two year’s Fellowship journey. Our Fellows come from diverse backgrounds, streams and
age group spanning over 100+ colleges, universities and few companies.
Join The Movement

Become part of a movement of 461 Alumni across Nepal and countless more globally and find 
life long collaborators in this work.
Watch Our Video
“Let’s ask ourselves - What if just 100 outstanding youth decided to stay back in this country 
every year?
And what if these 100 youths taught, empowered, and nurtured 10,000 students every year to 
become leaders, innovators, and creators?
Imagine where we would be in 10 years, in 20 years, in 30 years, and the kind of 
transformation that we could potentially witness within our lifetime."
Swastika Shrestha
CEO & Co-founder

Fellowship Begins
Generated with https://kome.ai

Being a Leader
The Teach for Nepal Fellowship focuses on leadership and working towards achieving success
for yourself and others. The Fellowship involves two years of full-time commitment. It is one of 
the most challenging and rewarding two years of leadership training available for young 
people.
The intensive leadership training program is designed to tackle some of the most pressing 
issues in Nepal – education inequality and quality of education – while preparing young people
to become effective leaders.
LEADERS IN THE CLASSROOM
Fellows take a leadership role from day one in the classroom. While teaching in high-need 
public schools in Nepal, Fellows play a key role in improving the academic outcomes - and 
thus, often the possible life trajectories – of students they teach. TFN Fellows will focus on 
maths, science, and English, three subjects that determine the future of over 90% of the

thus, often the possible life trajectories – of students they teach. TFN Fellows will focus on 
maths, science, and English, three subjects that determine the future of over 90% of the 
students who fail in the SLC. Fellows believe in the inherent potential of each student and 
work diligently to put each child onto a different life path.
Teach for Nepal Fellows lead by action, and display courage and compassion while supporting
children in difficult socio-economic circumstance to excel. They become role models.
LEADERS IN THE COMMUNITY
During the fellowship, Fellows will have the opportunity to identify, design, and implement 
community based projects. Called Mero samudaya mero dayitwa (My community, My 
Responsibility), Fellows will work with students, the school team, and community members to 
solve real problems in school or communities served by their school. These projects will 
benefit the community, and help Fellows develop project management and leadership skills.

solve real problems in school or communities served by their school. These projects will 
benefit the community, and help Fellows develop project management and leadership skills.
LEADERS OF TODAY AND LEADERS OF TOMORROW
A TFN Fellow’s commitment to excellence and leadership does not end after two years. As 
alumni, Teach for Nepal Fellows will engage in a variety of leadership roles to bring 
fundamental transformations to education in Nepal. They will become life-long leaders who 
work to ensure quality education for all children in Nepal.
Training
Teach for Nepal provides extensive training before and during the fellowship period to ensure 
that our Fellows are set to succeed in difficult circumstances and are able to put children in 
their classrooms on a transformative life path.
TRAINING INSTITUTE
The Fellowship begins with six weeks of intensive pre-service training. The Institute is the first 
Generated with https://kome.ai

stage towards becoming a successful leader in the classroom from day one. This residential 
training will focus on building reflective inquiry, emotional awareness, and self-confidence. 
Fellows begin to acquire the critical skills that they need to have to teach in the classrooms. 
Expert teacher-trainers and resource persons will guide the Fellows in developing the mindset 
and values needed to become a successful teacher. During this period Fellows will also have 
an opportunity to gain first hand experience of teaching through various practice teaching 
sessions. In addition, the Institute will have a component on community relations so that the 
Fellows are equipped to work with the school management team and community members in 
the region they are placed.
This six weeks is also an important opportunity to build lasting friendships with other Fellows 
who will be working together for the next two years.
PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TRAINING

This six weeks is also an important opportunity to build lasting friendships with other Fellows 
who will be working together for the next two years.
PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TRAINING
Given that Nepal's university education still lags behind in developing important soft skills 
required by the job market, Teach for Nepal Fellows will have a unique opportunity to go 
through personal and professional development training during the two years of Fellowship. 
Teach For Nepal Fellows come together every three months for Mini Learning Institute (MILI) 
for continuous professional development opportunity that will feature experts and leaders from 
various sectors.
Incentives
Teach for Nepal offers an attractive incentive package for selected Fellows. The package 
includes leadership training opportunities, financial incentives, internship and the possibility of 
job placements as well as opportunities for scholarships and graduate studies (for a Master’s

includes leadership training opportunities, financial incentives, internship and the possibility of 
job placements as well as opportunities for scholarships and graduate studies (for a Master’s 
degree) in prestigious colleges and universities in Nepal and abroad.
LEADERSHIP TRAINING
Teach For Nepal focuses on learning and exercising leadership skills in classrooms and 
communities. Leadership training begins with an intensive 6-8 weeks of pre-service training 
(also referred to as Learning Institute) before the Fellows enter the classrooms. Over the two 
years, the Fellows receive a variety of personal and professional development training. These 
trainings will prepare the Fellows to develop soft skills such as communication, presentation, 
project management, negotiation skills to become change agents and leaders for continued 
success in their career after they complete two years of service with Teach For Nepal.
Beyond Two Years

project management, negotiation skills to become change agents and leaders for continued 
success in their career after they complete two years of service with Teach For Nepal.
Beyond Two Years
Teach for Nepal alumni will have a broad range of options to pursue careers in the private 
sector, in public institutions, and I/NGOs. They will also have the opportunity to enter graduate
schools in Nepal and abroad. Two years of leadership training and experience on the ground 
will equip our fellows to become effective leaders in all sectors. Most importantly, they will be 
prepared to take various leadership roles to bring long term change to our education system.
Generated with https://kome.ai

SCHOLARSHIP OPPORTUNITIES
Teach For Nepal Fellows, who complete two years, have opportunity to compete for two full 
tuition scholarships to pursue MBA at Kings College in Nepal and 1 full tuition scholarship to 
pursue Masters degree at University of Bridgeport (UB) in the USA.
INTERNATIONAL RECOGNITION
As a member of an international network of social movements working around the globe, 
Teach for Nepal alumni will receive recognition from some of the best universities around the 
world:
Harvard University
Columbia University
Princeton University
Stanford University
Michigan State University
University of California-Los Angeles
University of Chicago
University of Michigan-Ann Arbor
University of Southern California (Rossier)
University of Wisconsin-Madison
